CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a specific type of conjugated polymer, which is the material of interest in the paragraph. It contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in the main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in the side chain.
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): This is an electron acceptor material used in conjunction with PBDT-TDPP-S to create the polymer solar cells.
3. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs): These are a type of solar cells that have attracted significant attention due to their potential for creating large-area, flexible photovoltaic devices through low-cost solution processing techniques.
4. Tandem and single junction structures: These are types of structures used in solar cells, with tandem structures having demonstrated a solar power conversion efficiency of 10.6% and single junction structures having demonstrated a solar power conversion efficiency of 9.2%.
5. Donor - acceptor (D-A) polymers: These are a class of polymers that have been successful in achieving high performance in polymer solar cells.
6. Main - chain D-A frame: This refers to the structure of some present polymers, which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain.
7. Side - chain D-A conjugated polymers: These are a new class of polymers proposed by Huang and co-workers, which have advantages over main-chain D-A polymers, such as deeper HOMO energy levels, better solubility, and internal charge transfer behavior.
8. Previously reported side - chain D-A polymers: These are specific types of side-chain D-A polymers that have exhibited a maximal solar power conversion efficiency of 4.74%.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM
3. Tandem structures
4. Single junction structures
5. Main-chain D-A polymers
6. Side-chain D-A conjugated polymers
7. Previously reported side-chain D-A polymers

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |
| Tandem structures |
| Single junction structures |
| Main-chain D-A polymers |
| Side-chain D-A conjugated polymers |
| Previously reported side-chain D-A polymers |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is a specific type of conjugated polymer, serving as an electron donor material in the paragraph.
2. Benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: This is a donor unit in the main chain of the conjugated polymer PBDT-TDPP-S.
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole: This is an acceptor unit in the side chain of the conjugated polymer PBDT-TDPP-S.
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM): This is an electron acceptor material used in the polymer solar cells.
5. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs): These are a type of solar cells that use a bulk heterojunction as the active layer.
6. Tandem and single junction structures: These are different types of structures used in PSCs.
7. Donor-acceptor (D-A) polymers: These are a class of polymers with donor and acceptor units.
8. Narrow band gap (NBG) polymers: These are a type of donor-acceptor polymers with broad absorption spectra.
9. Highest occupied molecular orbit (HOMO) energy levels: These are energy levels in a material related to its ability to donate electrons.
10. Two-dimensional-like structural feature: This refers to a structural property of side-chain D-A polymers that improves their solubility.
11. Internal charge transfer (ICT) behavior: This is a phenomenon where charge is transferred between different parts of a molecule.
12. Maximal PCE (power conversion efficiency): This is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting solar energy into electrical energy.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: Conjugated polymer, electron donor material
2. Benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene: Donor unit in main chain of PBDT-TDPP-S
3. Diketopyrrolopyrrole: Acceptor unit in side chain of PBDT-TDPP-S
4. HOMO energy levels: Energy levels related to electron donation ability (of PBDT-TDPP-S and other materials)
5. Two-dimensional-like structural feature: Structural property of side-chain D-A polymers
6. Maximal PCE (power conversion efficiency): Measure of efficiency of solar cells (in relation to side-chain D-A polymers)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO energy levels of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| Two-dimensional-like structural feature of side-chain D-A polymers |
| Maximal PCE (power conversion efficiency) of side-chain D-A polymers |

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: HOMO level = -5.34 eV
2. Solar cells:
   - Power conversion efficiency (PCE) = 4.89%
   - Open circuit voltage (Voc) = 0.84 V
   - Short circuit current (Jsc) = 10.04 mA cm^-2
   - Fill factor (FF) = 56.0%
3. Bulk heterojunction (BHJ) polymer solar cells (PSCs):
   - Highest solar power conversion efficiencies (PCE):
     - Tandem structure = 10.6%
     - Single junction structure = 9.2%
4. Side-chain D-A polymers:
   - Maximal PCE = 4.74%

These are the values (number + unit) of material properties mentioned in the paragraph. Note that the units for the solar cell properties are typically given in percentage (PCE), volts (Voc), milliamperes per square centimeter (Jsc), and percentage (FF).
